universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class CalendarView.CalendarDataSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.CalendarView.CalendarDataSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parcelable
    Enclosing class:
    CalendarView

    public static final class CalendarView.CalendarDataSet
extends Object
implements Parcelable
    Helper class that may be used to simplify management of months data set provided by implementation of CalendarView.CalendarAdapter. Data set instance uses instance of Calendar to properly calculate as size of the data set that can be obtained via getSize() also the proper positions for a specific year + month pairs that can be requested via calculateMonthPosition(int, int) or for a particular date via calculateMonthPosition(long). Data set boundaries (starting date and count of months) may be specified via setMinMaxDate(long, long).
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

      • set

        public void set(@NonNull
                CalendarView.CalendarDataSet dataSet)
        Sets all data of this data set from the specified one.
        Parameters:
        dataSet - The data set from which to set up this data set instance.

      • setCalendar

        public void setCalendar(@Nullable
                        Calendar calendar)
        Sets a calendar used by this data set properly calculate count of months according to specified data boundaries via setMinMaxDate(long, long) and also to calculate position of a month for a specific year + month pair via calculateMonthPosition(int, int).
        Parameters:
        calendar - The desired calendar instance. May be null to use default one.
        See Also:
        getCalendar()

      • getCalendar

        @NonNull
public Calendar getCalendar()
        Returns the calendar used by this data set for its size calculations and also for month positions calculations.
        Returns:
        This data set's calendar. Default is Calendar.getInstance().
        See Also:
        setCalendar(Calendar)

      • setMinMaxDate

        public boolean setMinMaxDate(long minDateInMillis,
                             long maxDateInMillis)
        Sets a minimum and maximum dates that are used to resolve from which date to start this data set and how large (in count of months) it should be.
        Parameters:
        minDateInMillis - The desired minimum date in milliseconds that determines the start of data set.
        maxDateInMillis - The desired maximum date in milliseconds. May be 0 to request "infinite" data set of months starting from the minimum date.
        Returns:
        True if data of this data set has changed, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getDateMin(), getDateMax()

      • getDateMin

        public long getDateMin()
        Returns the minimum date that limits size (count of months) of this data set.
        Returns:
        Minimum date in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        getDateMax(), setMinMaxDate(long, long)

      • getDateMax

        public long getDateMax()
        Returns the maximum date that limits size (count of months) of this data set.
        Returns:
        Maximum date in milliseconds. May be 0 if the current data set is "infinite".
        See Also:
        getDateMin(), setMinMaxDate(long, long)

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of this data set.
        Returns:
        Count of months provided by this data set calculated according to the min + max date boundaries specified via setMinMaxDate(long, long).
        See Also:
        getDateMin(), getDateMax()

      • calculateMonthPosition

        public int calculateMonthPosition(long dateInMillis)
        Same as calculateMonthPosition(int, int) for the specified dateInMillis from which will be extracted Calendar.YEAR and Calendar.MONTH values using Calendar.
        Parameters:
        dateInMillis - The desired date in milliseconds. Should contain year and month data.
        Returns:
        Computed month position.

      • calculateMonthPosition

        public int calculateMonthPosition(int year,
                                  int month)
        Calculates a position of month for the given year and month.
        Parameters:
        year - The year number of month for which to calculate position.
        month - The month number for which to calculate position.
        Returns:
        Computed position of the requested month within the current data set that is in size of getSize().

      • getMonthDate

        public long getMonthDate(int position)
        Returns the date for a month at the requested position calculated according to the min + max date boundaries specified via setMinMaxDate(long, long).
        Parameters:
        position - The position of month for which to obtain the date.
        Returns:
        Calculated date with Calendar.YEAR and Calendar.MONTH data in milliseconds.
